result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:07 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF70, 15CF234, 15CF420, AND 15CM204. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person with Atty Erik Mcfarland. 
COURT questions if there are any additions/corrections to PSI. 
Atty Mcfarland notes corrections to PSI. 
COURT notes letter from ADA re: State vs. Loomis. 
Atty Mcfarland states he has NOT seen letter from ADA. 
State provides letter to Atty Mcfarland. 
OTR: 3:11 pm BOTR: 3:12 pm 
COURT states it will NOT consider any opinions that arise from COMPAS Assessment as requested in letter. 
N.H. makes statement. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: In 15CF70: Ct. 2>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES. 
                                               : Ct. 3>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES. 
                           : In 15CM204: Ct. 2>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES. 
                                                  : Ct. 3>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - imposed and STAYED for 2 years probation
                                                  : Ct. 4>>2 years imprisonment 1 year IC and 1 year ES - imposed and STAYED for 2 years probation. 
                                                  : Ct. 5>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - imposed and STAYED for 2 years probation. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES and PROBATION ON ALL: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; no contact with victim without prior approval of dept; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization of agent; CC. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run consecutive except for the probation terms which are to run concurrent. 
COURT orders DNA sample and surcharge on felony conviction
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 256 days sentence credit on Ct. 2 in 15CF70 only. 
COURT finds the deft ineligible for CIP and eligible SAP. 
COURT remands deft into custody for transport to WI State Prison System. 
COURT allows counsel to retain copies of PSI. 
Adj: 4:11 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:44 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF70, 15CF234, 15CF420, AND 15CM204. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Erik Mcfarland.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF70: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF234: Ct. 1 (Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Harm/Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Child Abuse - Recklessly Cause Harm/Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
In 15CF420: Ct. 1 (Contempt - Ct. Nonsummary - Punitive Sanction)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM204: Ct. 1 (Intimidate Victim - Dissuade Complaints/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 6 (Contact after DA Arrest/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 7 (Intimidate Victim - Dissuade Complaints/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF70: Ct. 2 (DC/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                  : Ct. 3 (DC/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM204: Ct. 2 (Contact after DA Arrest/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                     : Ct. 3 (Contact after DA Arrest/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                     : Ct. 4 (Contact after DA Arrest/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                     : Ct. 5 (Contact after DA Arrest/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be prepared within 6 weeks of today. 
Sentencing set for 10/7/2015 at 3pm in Br. 3. 
Atty Mcfarland makes statement re: bond. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 4:03 pm

Final pre-trial on July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial on August 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s):  N.H.  (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.
